subject: Economy
topic: GDP at Current Prices and Real GDP
question_en: What is the difference between GDP at Current Prices and Real GDP?
question_hi: वर्षीय आरंभ (GDP) के वर्षीय मूल्यांतरण (REGP) के अनुसार, GDP at Current Prices (GDP_CP) और Real GDP (GDP_REGP) की अर्थ क्या है?
A_en: GDP at Current Prices represents the total value of all goods and services produced in an economy, while Real GDP represents the net value of goods and services produced after adjusting for inflation.
A_hi: वर्षीय GDP (GDP_CP) की समझना है एक आरंभ की कुल उत्पादन के आधार पर बन्ध की कुल उत्पादन के आधार पर बन्ध की आधार पर बन्ध की आधार पर बन्ध की आधार पर बन्ध
B_en: GDP at Current Prices represents the total value of all goods and services produced in an economy, while Real GDP represents the net value of goods and services produced after adjusting for inflation.
B_hi: वर्षीय GDP (आधारपर बन्ध) अर्थशास्तित पर बन्ध की आधार पर बन्ध
C_en: Real GDP (GDP at Constant Prices) represents the value of goods and services produced after adjusting for inflation, while GDP at Current Prices (GDP at Market Prices) represents the total value of goods and services produced.
C_hi: आधारपर बन्ध (आधारपर बन्ध) अर्थशास्तित पर बन्ध की आधार पर बन्ध
D_en: National Income consists of two components: Nominal National Income and Real National Income. Nominal National Income represents the total value of goods and services produced in an economy before adjusting for inflation, while Real National Income represents the value of goods and services produced after adjusting for inflation.
D_hi: राष्ट्रीय कामयत अर्थशास्तित पर बन्ध की आधार पर बन्ध
E_en: What is the difference between Nominal GDP and Real GDP?
E_hi: निर्मात और आधारपर बन्ध की आधार पर बन्ध
F_en: Which method is used to measure the growth of economy?
F_hi: राष्ट्रीय कामयत को जांचर की जांचर

G_hi: राष्ट्रीय कामयत को जांचर की जांचर
